posts.title: Happy Birthday, Oscar Wilde
posts.text: Before he died, Wilde knew that the prize was won, that his legacy would linger. And it has.

posts.title: Walt Whitman and The Poetics of Experience
posts.text: Walt Whitman wore many names. But the one he identified most with was, simply, poet. On the eve of the 200th anniversary of Whitman's birth, discover his influences and themes, and the ways he leaned on the past to create something new.

posts.title: Enmeshed: A Brief History of the Internet and the World Wide Web
posts.text: The recently celebrated 30th anniversary of the Web should not be confused with the inception of the internet itself, which began with a single, interrupted transmission nearly 50 years ago.

posts.title: All the World's A Stage: Storytelling and Truth
posts.text: Whether we've ever put pen to paper to spin a yarn (or fingers to keyboard), we're all storytellers. And, in a strange way, we are our stories. See what philosophers have shared about this very point across history.

posts.title: Navigating Today's Job Market Through Lifelong Learning
posts.text: The process of staying informed, relevant, and prepared for today's job market requires lifelong learning - one of the key missions of the New York Public Library.
